result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: of the sample.The XRD pattern and SEM image of Bi-Bi 2 WO 6 before and after the reaction showed that the catalyst morphology and structure did not change (Fig. S6 and S7, ESI ).As expected, the introduction of Bi QDs greatly enhances the solar-driven photochemical reduction performance of CO 2 into valuable fuels. It is worth noting that the color of Bi 2 WO 6 and 6-BT changed from white to black after the plasma treatment, which helps to improve the light absorption capacity of the catalyst.The

results indicate that 6-BT produces more CO 2 A and b-CO 3 2A intermediates in the process of photocatalytic CO 2 reduction, which effectively improves the activity of the solar-driven CO 2 reduction.Based on the above experimental results, we propose a possible photocatalytic CO 2 reduction mechanism of the X-BT photocatalyst (Fig. 9).Under light irradiation, Bi 2 WO 6 would be excited to produce photo-generated carriers (electrons and holes).Since Bi QDs have good conductivity, they can significantly

they can significantly enhance the visible light absorption capacity of Bi 2 WO 6 to generate more electron-hole pairs and conduct the photogenerated electrons.The excited electrons would transfer to Bi QDs immobilized on the surface of Bi 2 WO 6 , leaving a hole in the VB.Then, the photo-induced electrons would react with CO 2 to form CO. In this whole process, Bi QDs serve as an electron trap to induce the efficient separation of photogenerated electrons and holes.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction

factors, further control experiments were carried out, and the results are shown in Fig. 4b.Columns 2 and 3 display that no CO yield was detected when the reaction was carried out without a catalyst or in a dark environment, and the photocatalytic activity of Bi-Bi 2 WO 6 (6-BT) is significantly suppressed, verifying the crucial role of catalysts and light as driving forces in the CO 2 reduction.In addition, no product has been detected when Ar replaced CO 2 (column 4), demonstrating that CO and CH 4 are

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']

Lamp: XXX

It is worth noting that the color of Bi 2 WO 6 and 6-BT changed from white to black after the plasma treatment, which helps to improve the light absorption capacity of the catalyst.The

(DBD) plasma technology.The reduction of Bi QDs leads to the generation of a large number of unsaturated coordination atoms, which improves the light absorption performance of Bi 2 WO 6 .Benefiting from the unique interface design, black Bi 2 WO 6 shows superior CO generation rate, roughly threefold higher than that of pristine Bi 2 WO 6 nanosheets.Our work provides new insights and can be a reference in plasma modification engineering of catalyst surfaces and photoreduction of CO 2 .

capacity of the catalyst.The ultraviolet-visible diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) shown in Fig. 5a confirm this phenomenon.It is obvious that Bi 2 WO 6 exhibits the absorption edge at around 450 nm, while the absorption edge of the 6-BT catalyst in the visible light range has a significant red-shift to 490 nm.Moreover, the ability of photo-absorption is enhanced with the increase in the plasmatreated duration outside the range of 450 nm.The conversion diagram of the Kubelka-Munk function and light energy

(DBD) plasma technology.The reduction of Bi QDs leads to the generation of a large number of unsaturated coordination atoms, which improves the light absorption performance of Bi 2 WO 6 .Benefiting from the unique interface design, black Bi 2 WO 6 shows superior CO generation rate, roughly threefold higher than that of pristine Bi 2 WO 6 nanosheets.Our work provides new insights and can be a reference in plasma modification engineering of catalyst surfaces and photoreduction of CO 2 .
